type.descr: This type contains the description of a textkey. Please note that all text fields are in UTF-8.

elem.name: name
elem.descr: This is the localized name for the text key value given above.

elem.name: descr
elem.descr: This is the localized description for the text key value given above.

type.descr:
This type describes the limits for fields of an @ref AB_TRANSACTION. The limits have the following meanings:
maxLenSOMETHING: if 0 then this limit is unknown, if -1 then the described element is not allowed to be set in the transaction. All other values represent the maximum length of the described field.
minLenSOMETHING: if 0 then this limit is unknown. All other values represent the minimum length of the described field.
maxLinesSOMETHING: if 0 then this limit is unknown All other values represent the maximum number of lines for the described field.
minLinesSOMETHING: if 0 then this limit is unknown. All other values represent the minimum number of lines for the described field.
valuesSOMETHING: A list of allowed values (as string). If this list is empty then there all values are allowed (those lists @b exist in any case, so the appropriate getter function will never return NULL).
allowSOMETHING: If SOMETHING is allowed then the value is "1". If SOMETHING is NOT allowed then the value is "-1". If it is unknown whether SOMETHING is allowed or not then this value is "0".
So if you want to check whether an given field is at all allowed you must check whether "maxLenSOMETHING" has a value of "-1".

group.name: Local Account Number
group.descr: Limits for local account id suffix.

group.name: Remote Account Number Suffix
group.descr: Limits for remote account id suffix.

elem.name: valuesTextKey
elem.descr: This string list contains one entry for every supported text key. The values must be positive integers in decimal form (no leading zero, no comma or decimal point).

elem.name: textKeys
elem.descr: This list of text key descriptions may contain an entry for every supported text key. However, not all backends fill this list and this list does not have to be complete. If you want to know which textkeys are supported please use valuesTextKey instead.

group.name: Purpose
group.descr: Limits for purpose (called memo in some apps).

elem.name: needDate
elem.descr: Defines whether setting of the execution date (@ref AB_Transaction_SetDate) is required (value=1) or forbidden (value=-1), value=0 means "unknown".

group.name: Standing Orders And Dated Transfer
group.descr: These limits apply to standing orders and dated transfers only.

elem.name: minValueSetupTime
elem.descr: Minimum time in days between issuing of a request and its first execution.

elem.name: maxValueSetupTime
elem.descr: Maximum time in days between issuing of a request and its first execution.

elem.name: minValueSetupTimeFirst
elem.descr: Minimum time in days between issuing of a request and its first execution. This is for a first request (e.g. first debit note).

elem.name: maxValueSetupTimeFirst
elem.descr: Maximum time in days between issuing of a request and its first execution. This is for a first request (e.g. first debit note).

elem.name: minValueSetupTimeOnce
elem.descr: Minimum time in days between issuing of a request and its execution. This is for a one time only request (e.g. onetime debit note).

elem.name: maxValueSetupTimeOnce
elem.descr: Maximum time in days between issuing of a request and its execution. This is for a one time only request (e.g. onetime debit note).

elem.name: minValueSetupTimeRecurring
elem.descr: Minimum time in days between issuing of a request and its execution. This is for a following request (e.g. a recurring debit note).

elem.name: maxValueSetupTimeRecurring
elem.descr: Maximum time in days between issuing of a request and its first execution. This is for a following request (e.g. a recurring debit note).

elem.name: minValueSetupTimeFinal
elem.descr: Minimum time in days between issuing of a request and its execution. This is for a final request (e.g. last debit note).

elem.name: maxValueSetupTimeFinal
elem.descr: Maximum time in days between issuing of a request and its execution. This is for a final request (e.g. last debit note).

elem.name: valuesCycleWeek
elem.descr: This string list contains one entry for every supported cycle. These value are accepted when "period" is "weekly". The values must be positive integers in decimal form (no leading zero, no comma or decimal point). Allowed values are "0" (all cycles possible) and "1"-"52".

elem.name: valuesCycleMonth
elem.descr: This string list contains one entry for every supported cycle. These value are accepted when "period" is "monthly". The values must be positive integers in decimal form (no leading zero, no comma or decimal point). Allowed values are "0" (all cycles possible) and "1"-"12".

elem.name: valuesExecutionDayWeek
elem.descr: This string list contains one entry for every supported day of the week. These value are accepted when "period" is "weekly". The values must be positive integers in decimal form (no leading zero, no comma or decimal point). Allowed values are "0" (all days allowed) and "1"-"7".

elem.name: valuesExecutionDayMonth
elem.descr: This string list contains one entry for every supported monthly cycle. These value are accepted when "period" is "monthly". The values must be positive integers in decimal form (no leading zero, no comma or decimal point). Allowed are "0" (all days possible), "1"-"30", "97" (ultimo-2), "98" (ultimo-1) and "99" (ultimo).

values.value:
none
No period.

monthly
The standing order is to be executed every month.

weekly
The standing order is to be executed every week.

transaction
Simple transaction (as in transaction statements)

transfer
Transfer type of transaction (as used with transfer jobs)

debitNote
Debit note type of transaction (as used with debit note jobs)

euTransfer
EU-Transfer type of transaction (as used for with transfer jobs)

sepaTransfer
SEPA-Transfer type of transaction (as used with SEPA transfer jobs)

sepaDebitNote
SEPA debit note type of transaction (as used with SEPA debit note jobs)

internalTransfer
Internal transfer (transfer between accounts at the same bank)

none
No transfer sub-type

standard
Standard transfer.

check
Check.

bookedDebitNote
Debit note (Abbuchungsverfahren)

drawnDebitNote
Debit note (Einzugsermaechtigung)

standingOrder
Standing order (Dauerauftrag)

loan
Loan transfer.

euStandard
EU standard transfer.

euASAP
Eu transfer which is to be executed the same day.

buy
Buy stocks and alike

sell
Sell stocks and alike

reinvest
Reinvestment.

dividend
Dividend.

none
No status.

accepted
The transfer has been accepted by the bank.

rejected
The transfer has been rejected by the bank (or was erroneous).

pending
The transfer is still pending.

sending
The transfer is being sent.

autoReconciled
The transfer has automatically been reconciled.

manuallyReconciled
The transfer has automatically been reconciled.

revoked
The transfer has been revoked.

aborted
The transfer has been aborted.

Nobody
Nobody is to be charged.

local
Issuer is to be charged.

remote
Peer is to be charged.

share
Issuer and peer share the charges.

once
One-time operation, OOFF.

first
First operation with more following, FRST.

following
Following operation (not the first), RCUR.

final
Final operation (last), FNAL. Only used if it is known that this is the final one.

type.descr: This type contains all important information about transactions. All text fields are in UTF-8.

group.name: Local Account Info
group.descr: This group contains information about the local account.

elem.name: localCountry
elem.descr: This is the two-character country code according to ISO 3166-1 (Alpha-2). This is also used in DNS toplevel domain names. For Germany use "DE" (not case-sensitive).

elem.name: localBankCode
elem.descr: This is the code of the local bank (i.e. your bank).

elem.name: localBranchId
elem.descr: This is the branch id of the local bank (OFX only)

elem.name: localSuffix
elem.descr: If your account has subaccounts which are distinguished by different suffixes, then this is that suffix. Otherwise it's empty. (HBCI only)

elem.name: localIban
elem.descr:
International Bank Account Number according to ECBS EBS 204.
PosMeaning
0-1Country code according to ISO 3166
2-3Checksum
4-33Country specific account info
Examples:
BE62510007547061
FR1420041010050500013M02606

elem.name: localBic
elem.descr: This is the SWIFT id of the local bank.

group.name: Remote Account Info
group.descr: This group contains information about the remote account.

elem.name: remoteCountry
elem.descr: This is the two-character ISO country code (as used in toplevel domains). For Germany use "DE".

elem.name: remoteBranchId
elem.descr: This is the branch id of the remote bank (OFX only)

elem.name: remoteIban
elem.descr:
International Bank Account Number according to ECBS EBS 204.
PosMeaning
0-1Country code according to ISO 3166
2-3Checksum
4-33Country specific account info
Examples:
BE62510007547061
FR1420041010050500013M02606

elem.name: remoteBic
elem.descr: This is the SWIFT id of the local bank.

elem.name: uniqueId
elem.descr: This is a unique id assigned by the application. However, when adding a transaction to a job (like JobTransfer) this id is assigned by AqBanking to make sure that this id is unique across all applications.

elem.name: idForApplication
elem.descr: This is a unique id assigned by the application only. This id is never changed by AqBanking.

elem.name: groupId
elem.descr: This id is assigned by a backend when sending mutliple transfer jobs in one backend request (e.g. AqHBCI uses DTAUS files when sending multi-transfer requests; in this case every every transfer which goes into the same DTAUS file receives the same id).

elem.name: valutaDate
elem.descr: The date when the transaction was really executed (Datum Valuta/Wertstellung)

elem.name: date
elem.descr: The date when the transaction was booked (but sometimes it is unused). (Buchungsdatum)

group.name: Info Which Is Not Supported by All Backends

descr.p: This group contains information which differ between backends.
Some of this information might not even be supported by every backends.
A numerical transaction code, defined for all kinds of different actions. (Textschluessel)
For a normal transfer you should set it to 51. For debit notes the values 04 or 05 may be used. For other values please refer to your credit institute. (HBCI only)
An extension to the text key (Textschluesselergaenzung, SWIFT Feld 34)
For a normal transfer you should set it to 51. For debit notes the values 04 or 05 may be used. For other values please refer to your credit institute. (HBCI only)

elem.name: transactionKey
elem.descr: this is the transaction id that tells you more about the type of transaction (3 character code) (Buchungsschluessel) (HBCI only)

elem.name: customerReference
elem.descr: Reference string, if the customer (you) has specified one. (E.g. the cheque number.) Otherwise "NONREF" or empty (Kundenreferenz)

elem.name: bankReference
elem.descr: Reference string for this transaction given by the bank, if it has given one. Otherwise empty. (Bankreferenz)

elem.name: endToEndReference
elem.descr: This is a reference provided by the issuer of a SEPA transfer.

elem.name: originatorIdentifier
elem.descr: Used for SEPA transfers.

elem.name: transactionCode
elem.descr: A 3 digit numerical transaction code, defined for all kinds of different actions. (Geschaeftsvorfallcode)

elem.name: transactionText
elem.descr: Transaction text (e.g. STANDING ORDER) (Buchungstext)

descr.p: This is an id optionally assigned by the Financial Institute. It is mostly used by OFX.
This string list contains the purpose of the transaction. Every entry of this list represents a single purpose line.
This string list contains the categories this transaction belongs to. This element is not used by AqBanking itself but some im/exporter plugins may choose to use these.
This group contains information which is used with standing orders. It is not needed for other usage of this type.

elem.name: period
elem.descr: This variable contains the execution period (e.g. whether a standing order is to be executed weekly or monthly etc).

elem.name: cycle
elem.descr: The standing order is executed every cycle x period. So if period is weekly and cycle is 2 then the standing order is executed every 2 weeks.

elem.name: executionDay
elem.descr:
The execution day. The meaning of this variable depends on the content of period:
monthly: day of the month (starting with 1)
weekly: day of the week (starting with 1=Monday)

elem.name: firstExecutionDate
elem.descr: The date when the standing order is to be executed for the first time.

elem.name: lastExecutionDate
elem.descr: The date when the standing order is to be executed for the last time.

elem.name: nextExecutionDate
elem.descr: The date when the standing order is to be executed next (this field is only interesting when retrieving the list of currently active standing orders)

descr.p: This group contains information which is used with all kinds of transfers. It is setup by the function @ref AB_Banking_GatherResponses for transfers but not used by AqBanking otherwise.

elem.name: type
elem.descr: This variable contains the type of transfer (transfer, debit note etc).

elem.name: subType
elem.descr: This variable contains the sub-type of transfer.

elem.name: status
elem.descr: This variable contains the status of the transfer (accepted, rejected, pending). etc).

elem.name: charge
elem.descr: Specify who is to be charged for the transaction.

descr.p: This group contains information which is used with transfers to other countries in the world. It is used by backends and applications but not by AqBanking itself.
This group contains information which is used with investment/stock transfers. It is used by backends and applications but not by AqBanking itself.

group.name: Additional Information for SEPA Direct Debits

descr.p: This group contains information which is used with SEPA transfers within the European Community. It is used by backends and applications but not by AqBanking itself.

elem.name: creditorSchemeId
elem.descr: "Creditor Scheme Identification" ("Glaeubiger-ID", assigned by Deutsche Bundesbank)

elem.name: mandateId
elem.descr: "SEPA Direct debit mandate id

elem.name: mandateDate
elem.descr: "Issue date of the direct debit mandate

elem.name: mandateDebitorName
elem.descr: "Debitor name for direct debit mandate if given by the debtor

elem.name: originalCreditorSchemeId
elem.descr: Original value for "Creditor Scheme Identification", in case that value changed over time

elem.name: originalMandateId
elem.descr: "Original SEPA Direct debit mandate id, in case that changed over time

elem.name: originalCreditorName
elem.descr: "Original SEPA Direct debit creditor name, in case that changed over time

elem.name: sequenceType
elem.descr: Sequence type of the debit (one-time, first, recurring).
